Contacting a Military Subject Matter Expert

How can an Education Services Specialist Support Schools?

  • Branch Specific Education and Career Programs

    Get information on branch specific and Department of Defence education and career programs that benefit all students (eg. ASVAB-CEP; M25). Ask the education services specialist [ESS] to demonstrate the ASVAB-PTI dashboard and website.

  • ConAP

    Learn about ConAP and other college specific partnerships in your state and region. ConAP is the Army's Concurrent Admissions Program. ConAP is the Army's version of College Access Network program for our Future Soldiers who are enlisting and choosing their postsecondary institution at the same time.

  • Making Connections with School Counseling Programs

    An ESS can help you to make connections with MCDA/ACTE/MACAC/ Office OCTE/MITES.

  • Professional Learning Opportunities

    Invite an education services specialist to present on military careers or participate in professional development for school district or professional organization.

  • Participate in Educator Tour

    An Educator Tour is a hands-on, behind the scene experience that will show the educator how the Service prepares and trains service members to provide operations throughout today's ever - changing world. Tours are most often multi-day visits to active duty Service installations (posts).

    • Education Services
    • Static equipment displays
    • Military ceremonies
    • Community partnership events
    • Dining with service members
    • Lodging/housing
    • Training simulations
    • Basic/advanced training
    • Recreation and wellness facilities
    • Transition services
    • Soldier forums
    • Post Exchange
    • Hospital
    • Museums
    • Local attractions
    • All the amenities found in any city within the US

    For an example of what an individual Educator Tour might look like, see the resources below:

    • Great Lakes Army Educator & Community Partners Tour flyer, June, 2019
    • Army National Education Tour
    • Marine Corps Educator Workshop Experience
  • ASVAB Purpose, Demonstration, and Interpretation

    Invite an education services specialist to demonstrate ASVAB-CEP and post-test interpretation to a class, staff, or school board. You might also simply invite a Recruiter to have a one-on-one conversation about the ASVAB with you.

  • College and Career Fairs

    Include military at local college and career fairs and present them to students explaining link between military and college.

  • Coordinate Recruiter Training Services
    • Leadership Training
    • Resiliency Training
    • Education and Training Resources
    • Anti-Bullying Training
    • EMT / CPR / First Aid Training
  • Monthly Celebrations

    Especially for K-8 students, it can be helpful to incorporate the stories of military members and their careers during the various monthly celebrations such as Women’s History Month, Black History Month, Native American History Month. An example activity for Women’s History Month is included in this Military Careers and Career Clusters slide presentation.
